title: List Content Standards Response
description: Response payload with list of content standards configurations

oneOf.description: Success response - returns array of content standards

items.title: Content Standards
items.description: A content standards configuration defining brand safety and suitability policies. Standards are scoped by brand, geography, and channel. Multiple standards can be active simultaneously for different scopes.

standards_id.description: Unique identifier for this standards configuration

name.description: Human-readable name for this standards configuration

countries_all.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes. Standards apply in ALL listed countries (AND logic).

items.title: Media Channel
items.description: Standardized advertising media channels describing how buyers allocate budget. Channels are planning abstractions, not technical substrates. See the Media Channel Taxonomy specification for detailed definitions.

enumDescriptions.display: Digital display advertising (banners, native, rich media) across web and app
enumDescriptions.olv: Online video advertising outside CTV (pre-roll, outstream, in-app video)
enumDescriptions.social: Social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, etc.)
enumDescriptions.search: Search engine advertising and search networks
enumDescriptions.ctv: Connected TV and streaming on television screens
enumDescriptions.streaming_audio: Digital audio streaming services (Spotify, Pandora, etc.)
enumDescriptions.dooh: Digital out-of-home screens in public spaces
enumDescriptions.print: Newspapers, magazines, and other print publications
enumDescriptions.email: Email advertising and sponsored newsletter content
enumDescriptions.retail_media: Retail media networks and commerce marketplaces (Amazon, Walmart, Instacart)
enumDescriptions.affiliate: Affiliate networks, comparison sites, and performance-based partnerships
enumDescriptions.product_placement: Product placement, branded content, and sponsorship integrations

channels_any.description: Advertising channels. Standards apply to ANY of the listed channels (OR logic).

languages_any.description: BCP 47 language tags (e.g., 'en', 'de', 'fr'). Standards apply to content in ANY of these languages (OR logic). Content in unlisted languages is not covered by these standards.

policy.description: Natural language policy describing acceptable and unacceptable content contexts. Used by LLMs and human reviewers to make judgments.

calibration_exemplars.description: Training/test set to calibrate policy interpretation. Provides concrete examples of pass/fail decisions.

items.title: Artifact
items.description: Content artifact for safety and suitability evaluation. An artifact represents content adjacent to an ad placement - a news article, podcast segment, video chapter, or social post. Artifacts are collections of assets (text, images, video, audio) plus metadata and signals.

property_id.title: Identifier
property_id.description: Identifier for the property where this artifact appears

value.description: The identifier value. For domain type: 'example.com' matches base domain plus www and m subdomains; 'edition.example.com' matches that specific subdomain; '*.example.com' matches ALL subdomains but NOT base domain

artifact_id.description: Identifier for this artifact within the property. The property owner defines the scheme (e.g., 'article_12345', 'episode_42_segment_3', 'post_abc123').

variant_id.description: Identifies a specific variant of this artifact. Use for A/B tests, translations, or temporal versions. Examples: 'en', 'es-MX', 'v2', 'headline_test_b'. The combination of artifact_id + variant_id must be unique.

format_id.title: Format ID
format_id.description: Optional reference to a format definition. Uses the same format registry as creative formats.

agent_url.description: URL of the agent that defines this format (e.g., 'https://creatives.adcontextprotocol.org' for standard formats, or 'https://publisher.com/.well-known/adcp/sales' for custom formats)

id.description: Format identifier within the agent's namespace (e.g., 'display_static', 'video_hosted', 'audio_standard'). When used alone, references a template format. When combined with dimension/duration fields, creates a parameterized format ID for a specific variant.

width.description: Width in pixels for visual formats. When specified, height must also be specified. Both fields together create a parameterized format ID for dimension-specific variants.

height.description: Height in pixels for visual formats. When specified, width must also be specified. Both fields together create a parameterized format ID for dimension-specific variants.

duration_ms.description: Duration in milliseconds for time-based formats (video, audio). When specified, creates a parameterized format ID. Omit to reference a template format without parameters.

url.description: Optional URL for this artifact (web page, podcast feed, video page). Not all artifacts have URLs (e.g., Instagram content, podcast segments, TV scenes).

published_time.description: When the artifact was published (ISO 8601 format)

last_update_time.description: When the artifact was last modified (ISO 8601 format)

assets.description: Artifact assets in document flow order - text blocks, images, video, audio

role.description: Role of this text in the document. Use 'title' for the main artifact title, 'description' for summaries.

language.description: BCP 47 language tag for this text (e.g., 'en', 'es-MX'). Useful when artifact contains mixed-language content.

metadata.description: Rich metadata extracted from the artifact

asset_access.description: Authentication for accessing secured asset URLs

token.description: OAuth2 bearer token for Authorization header

pass.description: Artifacts that pass the content standards

items.title: Artifact
items.description: Content artifact for safety and suitability evaluation. An artifact represents content adjacent to an ad placement - a news article, podcast segment, video chapter, or social post. Artifacts are collections of assets (text, images, video, audio) plus metadata and signals.

property_id.description: Identifier for the property where this artifact appears

value.description: The identifier value. For domain type: 'example.com' matches base domain plus www and m subdomains; 'edition.example.com' matches that specific subdomain; '*.example.com' matches ALL subdomains but NOT base domain

artifact_id.description: Identifier for this artifact within the property. The property owner defines the scheme (e.g., 'article_12345', 'episode_42_segment_3', 'post_abc123').

variant_id.description: Identifies a specific variant of this artifact. Use for A/B tests, translations, or temporal versions. Examples: 'en', 'es-MX', 'v2', 'headline_test_b'. The combination of artifact_id + variant_id must be unique.

width.description: Width in pixels for visual formats. When specified, height must also be specified. Both fields together create a parameterized format ID for dimension-specific variants.

height.description: Height in pixels for visual formats. When specified, width must also be specified. Both fields together create a parameterized format ID for dimension-specific variants.

duration_ms.description: Duration in milliseconds for time-based formats (video, audio). When specified, creates a parameterized format ID. Omit to reference a template format without parameters.

url.description: Optional URL for this artifact (web page, podcast feed, video page). Not all artifacts have URLs (e.g., Instagram content, podcast segments, TV scenes).

published_time.description: When the artifact was published (ISO 8601 format)

last_update_time.description: When the artifact was last modified (ISO 8601 format)

assets.description: Artifact assets in document flow order - text blocks, images, video, audio

role.description: Role of this text in the document. Use 'title' for the main artifact title, 'description' for summaries.

language.description: BCP 47 language tag for this text (e.g., 'en', 'es-MX'). Useful when artifact contains mixed-language content.

metadata.description: Rich metadata extracted from the artifact

asset_access.description: Authentication for accessing secured asset URLs

token.description: OAuth2 bearer token for Authorization header

fail.description: Artifacts that fail the content standards

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

standards.description: Array of content standards configurations matching the filter criteria

errors.description: Field must not be present in success response

pagination.title: Pagination Response
pagination.description: Standard cursor-based pagination metadata for list responses

has_more.description: Whether more results are available beyond this page

cursor.description: Opaque cursor to pass in the next request to fetch the next page. Only present when has_more is true.

total_count.description: Total number of items matching the query across all pages. Optional because not all backends can efficiently compute this.

context.title: Context Object
context.description: Opaque correlation data that is echoed unchanged in responses. Used for internal tracking, UI session IDs, trace IDs, and other caller-specific identifiers that don't affect protocol behavior. Context data is never parsed by AdCP agents - it's simply preserved and returned.

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

items.title: Error
items.description: Standard error structure for task-specific errors and warnings

field.description: Field path associated with the error (e.g., 'packages[0].targeting')

retry_after.description: Seconds to wait before retrying the operation

standards.description: Field must not be present in error response

context.title: Context Object
context.description: Opaque correlation data that is echoed unchanged in responses. Used for internal tracking, UI session IDs, trace IDs, and other caller-specific identifiers that don't affect protocol behavior. Context data is never parsed by AdCP agents - it's simply preserved and returned.

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

_bundled.note: This is a bundled schema with all $ref resolved inline. For the modular version with references, use the parent directory.
